item.title: Revisit Concurrent Programming in Java
item.description: Recently I've gone through the “Concurrent Programming in Java” course on Coursera. Though the contents involved are very fundamental, I felt it's necessary to give them a revisit since they are building blocks of more advanced learning in concurrent and distributed world. Overview Overall, I figured this course followed a bottom-up approach. It first introduces low-level Java concurrent primitives, and then go through some of the high-level approaches that solve some of the problems when programming with the low-level concepts.

item.title: How This Blog was Built
item.description: Framework This blog is set up using Hugo framework. It's a fast and flexible framework written in Golang, and is a popular static site generator. There are various types of themes that are avaiable for use in Hugo, and the one I'm using is called m10c. Hugo is fairly easy to get started with, and the basic use of it might only involve a few CLI command. Most of the configurations and contents can be edited by adding key-value pairs in the config.
